column1: ConditionsPursuant to Article 29 of the San Francisco PoliceCode, a Night Noise Permit for operation in the PublicRight-of-Way shall be required for work that createsany noise 5dBA above the ambient noise level of thatarea at the nearest property plane.The Permit Holder shall disclose at the time ofapplication ALL equipment and tools to be used in thepublic right-of-way in conjunction with the proposedwork. Failure to do so may result in revocation of thepermit and may follow with associated notice(s) ofviolation and fines.It shall be the permit holderâ€™s responsibility to obtain aNight Noise Permit for any work which creates sound5dBA above the ambient level of that area at thenearest property plane. Failure to obtain appropriatepermits will result in appropriate action taken by theCity and may result in notices of violation withassociated fines, revocation of the permit foroccupancy and/or work, and/or other consequences.A Night Noise Permit shall be required for use of any ofthe following equipment:- Vehicle with back-up beepers/alarms- Generators- Vacuums/Vac-trucks- Power toolsEvent/Operation:Permit Linear Footage4660Elements of OccupancyMoving from utility pole to utility pole placing aerialstrand for fiber optic cable. Work will not exceed30mins per location.From:3/17/2016 7:00AMStart Time7:00AMTo:3/23/2016 5:00PMEnd Time5:00PMNeed to call for InspectionNeed to post tow-away signNSpecial Traffic permit requiredNFood:NOther:Performing Arts:NStreet Space Hours7:00AM Thru 5:00PMMeter Segment(s)Night Noise

column4: Prior to construction, all CCSFsurvey monuments shall bereferenced by a licensed LandSurveyor on a Corner Record ora Record of Survey if anyconstruction will take placewithin 10 ft of a monument. Forany questions, please emailMonument.Preservation@sfdpw.org or call 415-554-5827.Note, all survey monumentsshall be preserved per state lawand disturbance of a surveymonument may be a crime.
